intro: Bupleurum lanceolatum, commonly known as narrowleaf skullcap, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Bupleurum lanceolatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting pollinators and providing habitat for various wildlife.
